intro: Cuphea heteropetala, commonly known as the flame bean or fire bean, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, opposite leaves and produces small, bean-like seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and containers. Its unique appearance and vibrant colors make it a visually appealing ornamental plant.
